questions.text: In a 35-year-old man exhibiting loss of appetite, belching and burning abdominal pain, which of the following anatomical structures is affected?
Which of the following anatomical structures is affected in Barrett's esophagus?
Which of the following conditions is a pregnant woman more prone to develop?
What is the characteristic histological feature of Hirschsprung disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased number of ganglion cells in the affected area

options.label: B
options.text: Lack of ganglion cells in the afflicted area

options.label: C
options.text: Fibrosis of the submucosal and myenteric plexuses

options.label: D
options.text: Infiltration of eosinophils in the affected area

questions.correct_answer: B. Lack of ganglion cells in the afflicted area

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT correct regarding the layers of the embryonic disc?

options.label: A
options.text: The epiblast develops into the ectoderm, mesoderm, and endoderm germ layers.

options.label: B
options.text: The hypoblast plays a role in the yolk sac's development.

options.label: C
options.text: The epiblast and hypoblast are formed during the gastrulation stage of embryonic development.

options.label: D
options.text: The hypoblast gives rise to the amniotic sac.

questions.correct_answer: D. The hypoblast gives rise to the amniotic sac.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT an internal carotid artery (ICA) branch?

A 60-year-old male patient presents with a history of chest pain and shortness of breath. On examination, a systolic murmur is heard over the precordium, and electrocardiography (ECG) reveals ST-segment elevation. The patient is diagnosed with acute coronary syndrome and requires emergency cardiac surgery. During the surgical procedure, the surgeon is carefully dissecting the posterior surface of the heart. Which structures would the surgeon encounter while operating on this surface?
questions.correct_answer: C. Left atrium and left ventricle

questions.text: A 35-year-old overweight female underwent a D & C surgery. The surgery was done in the lithotomy position and was successful. Post-procedure, however, the patient had paralysis of the adductor muscles and numbness in the medial side of the thigh. What could be the possible reason for this complication?

options.label: A
options.text: Pudendal nerve injury during the procedure.

options.label: B
options.text: Obturator nerve injury due to lithotomy positioning

options.label: C
options.text: Femoral nerve injury during the procedure

options.label: D
options.text: Superficial peroneal nerve injury due to compression during the procedure.

questions.correct_answer: B. Obturator nerve injury due to lithotomy positioning

questions.text: You are taking an anatomy class for your juniors in the dissection hall regarding the topic of Salivary glands. Which of the following may be a wrong statement regarding the Stenson’s duct?

options.label: A
options.text: The accessory parotid gland is located below it.

options.label: B
options.text: It is commonly about 5 centimetre in length.

options.label: C
options.text: It has an oblique course through the buccinator muscle.

options.label: D
options.text: It terminates at the vestibule region of the mouth, approximately opposite to the crown of the 2nd upper molar tooth.

questions.correct_answer: A. The accessory parotid gland is located below it.

questions.text: Which of the following is a characteristic feature of atavistic joints?

A 45-year-old male patient presents with weakness and numbness in his left arm and leg. A CT scan reveals a blockage in the blood vessels supplying the somatosensory area of the brain. Which artery from the list below is most likely to be impacted?

A 46-year-old man was brought to the hospital due to complaints of the unequal pupil of the left eye, blurred vision and inability to sweat normally. An MRI scan reveals damage to the sympathetic trunk. Which of the following is the diagnosis of the doctors for the patient?

A 6-year-old boy presents with swelling around his eyes and in his lower extremities that has been getting worse over the past few weeks. He has also been complaining of abdominal pain and has been urinating more frequently. On examination, he is found to have marked edema around his eyes, legs, and abdomen. His urine dipstick test reveals significant proteinuria. His serum albumin level is found to be low. A renal biopsy is performed and is shown below.

A 27-year-old pregnant woman presents with complaints of fever, fatigue, and flu-like symptoms for the past week. She is in her 22nd week of gestation and has not received any prenatal care yet. On further evaluation, it is found that she is positive for torch infections. Which of the following is the most likely cause of her symptoms?

A 2-year-old child is brought to the clinic by their parents for a routine check-up. The child is able to walk, but still falls frequently. He can say a few words like "mama" and "dada", but are not yet forming sentences. On examination, the child is able to stack blocks, but has difficulty drawing basic shapes. Which of the following developmental milestones is the child most likely delayed in?
questions.explanation:
Age Range

Milestones

0-3 months

Lifting head while lying on stomach, pushing up on arms while lying on stomach, kicking legs while lying on back

4-6 months

Rolling over, sitting with support, reaching for objects while lying on back or stomach

7-12 months

Crawling, standing with support, pulling to stand, walking while holding onto furniture

1-2 years

Walking independenty, climbing stairs with assistance, kicking a ball, running

2-3 years

Jumping with both feet, climbing stairs independently, riding a tricycle

3-4 years

Jumping off of a low step, skipping, throwing a ball overhand

4-5 years

Hopping on one foot, jumping over small objects, catching a ball with hands

5-6 years

Skipping with alternating feet, riding a bike without training wheels, throwing and catching a ball with accuracy

Age Range

Milestones

0-3 months

Grasping reflex, bringing hands to mouth

4-6 months

Reaching for and grasping objects, transferring objects from one hand to the other

7-12 months

Picking up small objects with thumb and forefinger, banging objects together

1-2 years

Scribbling with crayons or pencils, building towers with blocks

 

2-3 years

Stringing beads, turning pages in a book, using scissors with supervision

3-4 years

Drawing basic shapes, using utensils to eat independently, buttoning and unbuttoning clothing

4-5 years

Drawing detailed pictures, tying shoelaces, using a knife and fork

5-6 years

Writing letters and numbers, completing puzzles with smaller pieces, sewing simple stitche

Age Range

Milestones

0-3 months

Recognizes caregiver's voice, coos and makes sounds

4-6 months

Babbles, imitates sounds and facial expressions

7-12 months

Understands simple words like "no" and "bye-bye", says first words like "mama" or "dada"

1-2 years

Follows simple instructions, says 2-word phrases, vocabulary of about 50 words

2-3 years

Uses 3-4 word sentences, asks simple questions, understands and follows more complex instructions

3-4 years

Tells stories, asks "why" questions, uses more complex sentences

4-5 years

Uses past tense correctly, uses prepositions, uses complex sentences with "and" and "because"

5-6 years

Uses correct grammar most of the time, retells stories in sequence, understands jokes and pun

Age Range

Milestones

0-3 months

Smiles at familiar faces, begins to develop trust

4-6 months

Shows interest in people, imitates facial expressions, recognizes familiar faces

7-12 months

Enjoys social interaction, shows affection, may be shy or anxious around strangers

1-2 years

Plays alongside other children (parallel play), imitates others, shows empathy

2-3 years

Engages in cooperative play, shares toys, takes turns

3-4 years

Develops friendships, shows concern for others, takes turns and plays cooperatively

4-5 years

Resolves conflicts with peers, understands and follows social rules, has best friends

5-6 years

Cooperates with others to achieve goals, shows concern for others' feelings, follows social rule

questions.text: A 32-week gestational age male baby weighing 1.2 kg is born to a mother with poor antenatal care. The baby has a head circumference of 26 cm, length of 38 cm, and an abdominal circumference of 20 cm. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 34-week gestational age baby is born with respiratory distress, tachypnea, and grunting. On physical examination, there is decreased breath sounds and fine crackles heard over the lung fields. The baby is not improving with oxygen therapy. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 2-day-old baby presents with cyanosis, poor feeding, and a loud, single second heart sound. On examination, there is a systolic ejection murmur heard over the left sternal border.. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 2-year-old child presents with a white pupil and strabismus in the right eye. Examination reveals a white, spherical mass in the right eye with surrounding retinal detachment. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A newborn infant is found to have a defect in the lower spinal region with a sac-like protrusion containing spinal cord and meninges. On further evaluation, it is diagnosed as myelomeningocele. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial management for this infant?

options.label: A
options.text: Surgical closure of the defect within 24 hours of birth

questions.correct_answer: A. Surgical closure of the defect within 24 hours of birth

questions.text: Which of the following types of hyperplasia is not considered a physiological response?
Which of the following is not a mechanism of reversible cell injury?

options.label: C
options.text: Formation of mitochondrial permeability transition pores

questions.correct_answer: C. Formation of mitochondrial permeability transition pores

questions.text: Which of the following types of necrosis is characterized by the formation of amorphous eosinophilic debris with no nuclear remnants?

A 45-year-old woman presents with a painless lump in her left breast that was discovered incidentally during a routine mammogram. Ultrasound examination reveals a well-defined, hypoechoic mass with thin, elongated extensions into the ductal system. Biopsy of the mass confirms the presence of an intraductal papilloma. Which of the following statements is true regarding intraductal papilloma?

options.label: A
options.text: Sheets of malignant cells with high mitotic activity

options.label: C
options.text: Epithelial projections lined by myoepithelial cells

options.label: D
options.text: Infiltrative growth pattern with irregular borders

questions.correct_answer: C. Epithelial projections lined by myoepithelial cells

questions.text: A 15-year-old male presents to the orthopedic clinic with a three-month history of persistent right knee pain. Physical examination reveals tenderness over the distal femur and limitation of knee movement. Imaging studies show a destructive lesion in the distal femur with periosteal reaction and soft tissue swelling as seen in image. Biopsy of the lesion shows malignant cells that produce osteoid. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old female presents with fatigue, malaise, and intermittent claudication in the upper extremities. On examination, there is a decreased pulse in the right brachial artery, absent radial and ulnar pulses, and a blood pressure difference of > 10 mmHg between the two arms. A CT angiogram shows thickening and stenosis of the subclavian and carotid arteries. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old male presents with fever, malaise, and chest pain. On examination, a friction rub is heard over the precordium. ECG shows diffuse ST elevation. A biopsy of the heart shows the presence of Aschoff bodies. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female presents with a painless, slowly growing mass on her right leg. On examination, the mass is well-circumscribed and mobile. MRI shows a well-defined mass arising from a nerve sheath with no invasion of surrounding tissues. Biopsy of the mass reveals spindle-shaped cells arranged in a palisading pattern. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old female presents a history of fatigue, weight gain, and cold intolerance. On examination, she has a diffuse goitre with no nodules or tenderness, as seen in the image. Her thyroid function tests show elevated thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) and low free thyroxine (FT4) levels. Thyroid peroxidase antibody (TPOAb) levels are also elevated. A fine-needle aspiration thyroid biopsy shows lymphocytic infiltration and Hurthle cell changes. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old male presents with a history of recurrent kidney stones and abdominal pain. He also reports a family history of pancreatic tumours and hyperparathyroidism. Physical examination reveals no abnormalities. Laboratory investigations show elevated serum calcium levels, parathyroid hormone, and urinary calcium excretion. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the characteristic feature of medullary carcinoma of the thyroid?
questions.correct_answer: C. Positive immunohistochemical staining for calcitonin

questions.text: A 65-year-old male presents with complaints of difficulty swallowing, regurgitation of food, and bad breath for the past few months. On examination, there is no cervical lymphadenopathy or thyroid enlargement. Barium swallow reveals a posterior outpouching of the pharyngeal mucosa just above the upper esophageal sphincter. A diagnosis of Zenker's diverticulum is suspected. Which of the following is the most likely pathogenesis of Zenker's diverticulum in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Infection of the pharynx causing inflammation and weakening of the pharyngeal muscles

options.label: B
options.text: Chronic irritation of the esophagus due to acid reflux

options.label: C
options.text: Congenital malformation of the pharynx and esophagus

options.label: D
options.text: Weakness in the muscle layer between the thyropharyngeus and cricopharyngeus muscles

questions.correct_answer: D. Weakness in the muscle layer between the thyropharyngeus and cricopharyngeus muscles

questions.text: A 35-year-old female presents with a history of recurrent abdominal pain and episodes of intestinal obstruction. She also reports having multiple small brown spots on her lips and oral mucosa. Family history is significant for similar skin lesions and gastrointestinal polyps in her father and siblings. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 60-year-old male presents with a painless swelling in the parotid region that has gradually increased in size over the last few months. He has a history of smoking cigarettes for the past 30 years. On examination, the swelling is found to be soft, non-tender, and mobile. Fine needle aspiration cytology (FNAC) reveals the presence of epithelial cells and lymphoid cells. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is a germ cell tumor of the testis?
Which of the following is a true statement regarding the pathophysiology of von Willebrand disease (VWD)?

options.label: A
options.text: VWD is caused by a deficiency or dysfunction of factor VIII.

options.label: B
options.text: VWD is an X-linked recessive disorder.

options.label: C
options.text: VWD results in impaired platelet function and defective clotting factor activation.

options.label: D
options.text: VWD is characterized by decreased levels of fibrinogen.

questions.correct_answer: C. VWD results in impaired platelet function and defective clotting factor activation.

questions.text: Which of the following enzyme is not involved in the glycolytic pathway?
Which one of the following enzymes is involved in lipogenesis?
What is the respiratory quotient (RQ)?

options.label: A
options.text: The ratio of glucose consumption to oxygen consumption.

options.label: B
options.text: The ratio of oxygen consumption to glucose consumption.

options.label: C
options.text: The ratio of carbon dioxide production to oxygen consumption by using expelled air.

options.label: D
options.text: The ratio of carbon dioxide production to oxygen consumption at cellular levels.

questions.correct_answer: D. The ratio of carbon dioxide production to oxygen consumption at cellular levels.

questions.text: Substrate level phosphorylation occurs during which of the following metabolic pathways?

A 2-year-old male child presents with developmental delay, hepatosplenomegaly, and recurrent infections. His parents report that he also has episodes of diarrhoea and vomiting. Physical examination shows coarse facial features, a prominent forehead, and a large tongue. Laboratory investigations reveal low platelet count and elevated liver enzymes. Which of the subsequent diagnoses is most likely?
Which of the following coenzymes is involved in the transfer of acyl groups?
Which of the following is not a key enzyme in ketogenesis?
Which of the following transporters is responsible for the transport of glucose across the plasma membrane of most mammalian cells?
The Warburg effect is a phenomenon observed in cancer cells in which they exhibit the following:

options.label: B
options.text: Increased glucose uptake and lactate production

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased glucose uptake and lactate production

questions.correct_answer: B. Increased glucose uptake and lactate production

questions.text: The structure given below is of:

A 45-year-old female with a history of chronic anemia receives a transfusion of packed red blood cells (PRBCs) for an acute exacerbation of her anemia. Shortly after the transfusion begins, she develops a fever, chills, and shortness of breath. The transfusion is stopped, and the patient is evaluated for a transfusion reaction. Which of the following is the most likely transfusion reaction that the patient is experiencing?

A 35-year-old female with type 1 diabetes presents with abdominal pain and vomiting. On laboratory testing, she has a high anion gap metabolic acidosis. Which of the following is the most likely cause?
In the colon, bacterial fermentation of fibres produces short-chain fatty acids (SCFAs). Which of the following is not a function of SCFAs?

options.label: A
options.text: Provide a major source of energy for colonocytes

options.label: B
options.text: Stimulate the release of satiety hormones

options.label: C
options.text: Regulate immune function in the gut

questions.correct_answer: D. Stimulate gluconeogenesis in the liver

questions.text: A 42-year-old female presents to the emergency department with severe abdominal pain, bloating, and diarrhea. She reports a history of gallstones and a recent high-fat meal. Laboratory tests reveal elevated levels of pancreatic enzymes. Which of the following is the most likely cause of her symptoms?

options.label: A
options.text: Impaired fat digestion due to gallstone obstruction of the common bile duct.

options.label: B
options.text: Increased fat absorption due to a deficiency of pancreatic lipase.

options.label: C
options.text: Enhanced fat absorption due to a deficiency of bile salts.

options.label: D
options.text: Decreased fat absorption due to a deficiency of chylomicrons.

questions.correct_answer: A. Impaired fat digestion due to gallstone obstruction of the common bile duct.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about the peristaltic reflex is true?

options.label: A
options.text: The peristaltic reflex is a spinal reflex independent of the brain.

options.label: B
options.text: The peristaltic reflex is initiated by distension of the colon and results in the relaxation of the colon wall.

options.label: C
options.text: The enteric nervous system mediates the peristaltic reflex and coordinates smooth muscle contractions in the digestive tract.

options.label: D
options.text: The peristaltic reflex is inhibited by sympathetic nervous system activation and results in decreased digestive tract motility.

questions.correct_answer: C. The enteric nervous system mediates the peristaltic reflex and coordinates smooth muscle contractions in the digestive tract.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about the absorption of dipeptides and tripeptides is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Dipeptides and tripeptides are absorbed into the bloodstream by active transport.

options.label: B
options.text: Dipeptides and tripeptides are hydrolyzed by enzymes in the small intestine before being absorbed.

options.label: C
options.text: Dipeptides and tripeptides are absorbed by the same mechanism as free fatty acids.

options.label: D
options.text: Dipeptides and tripeptides are too large to be absorbed and are excreted in the feces.

questions.correct_answer: A. Dipeptides and tripeptides are absorbed into the bloodstream by active transport.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about the migrating motor complex (MMC) is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: MMC is responsible for mixing and grinding of food in the stomach.

options.label: B
options.text: MMC is a continuous wave of contractions that occur throughout the gastrointestinal tract.

options.label: C
options.text: MMC is initiated by the presence of food in the stomach.

options.label: D
options.text: MMC is important for preventing bacterial overgrowth in the small intestine.

questions.correct_answer: D. MMC is important for preventing bacterial overgrowth in the small intestine.

questions.text: Which of the following is correct regarding the isovolumetric relaxation phase of the cardiac cycle?

options.label: C
options.text: Excitation is completed in both ventricles simultaneously

options.label: D
options.text: Completion of RV or LV excitation depends on the side in which it begins first

questions.correct_answer: C. Excitation is completed in both ventricles simultaneously

questions.text: Which of the following is a buffer system present in the human body?
Which of the following explains the stomach's acidification mechanism correctly?

options.label: A
options.text: The stomach releases bicarbonate ions, which react with hydrogen ions to form carbonic acid, releasing protons.

options.label: B
options.text: The gastric parietal cells secrete hydrogen ions via the H+/K+ ATPase pump, while the anions (Cl-) enter the lumen via the chloride channel.

options.label: C
options.text: The stomach releases hydrochloric acid, which reacts with water to form hydronium and chloride ions.

options.label: D
options.text: The stomach secretes sodium ions into the lumen, which reacts with chloride ions to form sodium chloride, releasing hydrogen ions.

questions.correct_answer: B. The gastric parietal cells secrete hydrogen ions via the H+/K+ ATPase pump, while the anions (Cl-) enter the lumen via the chloride channel.

questions.text: Which of the following is the primary factor affecting glomerular filtration rate (GFR) in the kidneys?

options.label: A
options.text: Blood pressure in the glomerular capillaries

options.label: B
options.text: Concentration of sodium ions in the filtrate

options.label: C
options.text: Thickness of the glomerular basement membrane

questions.correct_answer: A. Blood pressure in the glomerular capillaries

questions.text: A 45-year-old male with a history of hypertension presents to the clinic complaining of swelling in his legs and feet. His blood pressure is elevated, and laboratory tests reveal elevated serum creatinine levels and blood urea nitrogen. Which of the following mechanisms regulates GFR in the kidney?

28-year-old Sam was diagnosed with acute lymphocytic leukemia 7 months ago. Since then, he received intensive chemotherapy with intravenous and intrathecal methotrexate and other drugs, eventually leading to cancer remission. However, he recently presented with severe cough and breathing difficulties. Considering his prolonged use of methotrexate, what could be the lung pathology?

A study compared the efficacy of two biological agents, ipilimumab and pembrolizumab, in treating advanced melanoma. The study included 400 patients, 200 of whom were randomly assigned to receive ipilimumab and 200 of whom were randomly assigned to receive pembrolizumab. After 6 months of treatment, 100 patients in the ipilimumab group and 120 patients in the pembrolizumab group responded to treatment. What is the absolute risk reduction (ARR) of ipilimumab compared to pembrolizumab in this study?

A 45-year-old male has recently been diagnosed with chronic myeloid leukemia. It has been detected in the early stages, and he looks fit clinically. Immediate intervention may help prevent complications from the disease. Which of the following drugs is the drug of choice and proven treatment for his treatment?

A clinical trial compared the efficacy of two nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs), zidovudine (AZT) and abacavir (ABC), in the treatment of HIV. The trial included 500 patients, 250 of whom were randomly assigned to receive AZT and 250 of whom were randomly assigned to receive ABC. After 24 weeks of treatment, 40 patients in the AZT group and 50 in the ABC group achieved a viral load below the detection limit. What is the relative risk reduction (RRR) of AZT compared to ABC in this study?

A 45-year-old male was diagnosed with Aspergillosis and is critically ill. He requires an injection of amphotericin as part of his treatment. When explaining the adverse effects of the drug, which of the following formulations of amphotericin is the most nephrotoxic?

A 35-year-old patient with leprosy has been prescribed dapsone as part of a multidrug therapy regimen. The patient asks the healthcare provider about the mechanism of action of dapsone. The healthcare provider explains that dapsone is a bacteriostatic agent that works by inhibiting the folic acid synthesis in bacteria. The patient asks about the specific target of dapsone in the folic acid synthesis pathway. Which of the following is the correct target of dapsone in the folic acid synthesis pathway?

A 36-year-old man with multidrug-resistant tuberculosis (MDR-TB) has been started on a delamanid, linezolid, and levofloxacin treatment regimen. However, after 2 months of treatment, he developed peripheral neuropathy and required the discontinuation of linezolid. Which of the following represents the ideal course of managerial action?

options.label: A
options.text: Switch to a regimen consisting of bedaquiline, clofazimine, and levofloxacin.

options.label: B
options.text: Increase the dose of delamanid and levofloxacin and continue treatment for the full 20-month duration

options.label: C
options.text: Replace linezolid with ethambutol and continue the current regimen for the full 20-month duration

options.label: D
options.text: Discontinue the current regimen and start a new regimen consisting of amikacin, moxifloxacin, and cycloserine

questions.correct_answer: A. Switch to a regimen consisting of bedaquiline, clofazimine, and levofloxacin.

questions.text: A 60-year-old man with a history of hypertension, diabetes mellitus, and stable angina presents to the emergency department with sudden chest pain and shortness of breath. His electrocardiogram shows ST-segment elevation in leads II, III, and aVF, and he is diagnosed with an acute inferior myocardial infarction. He is started on aspirin, clopidogrel, and heparin and taken to the cardiac catheterization lab, where a right coronary artery (RCA) occlusion is identified. The RCA is successfully opened with angioplasty and stent placement. However, the patient continues to experience chest pain, and the decision is made to administer a glycoprotein IIb/IIIa inhibitor. Which of the following statements regarding glycoprotein IIb/IIIa inhibitors is true?

options.label: A
options.text: They selectively inhibit platelet aggregation by blocking the ADP receptor

options.label: B
options.text: They act by inhibiting the conversion of angiotensin I to angiotensin II

options.label: C
options.text: They block the binding of fibrinogen to the platelet glycoprotein IIb/IIIa receptor

options.label: D
options.text: They directly activate plasminogen to convert it to plasmin

questions.correct_answer: C. They block the binding of fibrinogen to the platelet glycoprotein IIb/IIIa receptor
questions.explanation:
Drug Mechanism of action

Glycoprotein IIb/IIIa inhibitors

  • Abciximab
  • Tirofiban
                                  
  • It binds to the GP IIb/IIIa receptors which results in the inhibition of platelet aggregation.

TXA2 Synthesis inhibitor

  • Aspirin
  • Acetylation
  • It prevents platelet aggregation by inhibiting cyclooxygenase.

P2Y12 inhibitors

  • Clopidogrel
  • Ticagrelor
  • It suppresses the platelet aggregation and platelet adhesion to injury site by blocking the ADP receptors.

questions.text: A 48-year-old woman with a history of rheumatoid arthritis has been on medical management for many years. Recently, however, she has been experiencing severe pain in the epigastric region, usually exacerbated before meals. Link to chronic piroxicam usage is suspected. What is an alternative painkiller for her?

A 60-year-old woman presented to your OPD for review. She is a known case of rheumatoid arthritis, along with other comorbidities as well. From the long list of medications, she is on, which of the following is not a DMARD?

In one year, a 45-year-old man developed a sudden, painful vision loss at the movie theatre. At the emergency room, he was started on mannitol, acetazolamide, pilocarpine and timolol. What is the mechanism of action of timolol in his condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Increase trabecular outflow by contracting sphincter pupillae

options.label: B
options.text: Decongestion of the eye by osmotic action

options.label: C
options.text: Decrease the formation of aqueous humor

options.label: D
options.text: It inhibits carbonic anhydrase and decreases the aqueous formation

questions.correct_answer: C. Decrease the formation of aqueous humor

questions.text: An 18-year-old male with a known case of Von-Hippel-Lindau syndrome presented with uncontrolled hypertension and severe headaches. After evaluation, he was diagnosed with pheochromocytoma. Which of the following is the drug of choice for hypertension control before surgery?

A 16-year-old male presents to the clinic complaining of involuntary movements and sounds for the past year. He reports frequent blinking, facial grimacing, and vocal tics such as throat clearing and sniffling. He mentions that these tics have affected his school performance and social life. On further evaluation, the patient is diagnosed with Tourette syndrome. Which of the following medications is most likely effective in treating Tourette syndrome in this patient?

A 28-year-old man with a history of obsessive-compulsive disorder is started on a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) to treat his symptoms. After a few weeks of treatment, he reports difficulty achieving and maintaining an erection. What is the most likely adverse effect of the SSRI in this patient?

A 35-year-old male presents to the emergency department with a 2-week history of low mood, decreased interest in activities, and decreased energy. He reports hearing voices that are critical of him and telling him to harm himself. He denies any history of substance abuse or previous psychiatric illness. On examination, he appears tearful, with psychomotor retardation and paranoid delusions. What is the most appropriate treatment for this patient's condition?

options.label: D
options.text: A combination of antidepressants and antipsychotics

questions.correct_answer: D. A combination of antidepressants and antipsychotics

questions.text: A 25-year-old male presents with a complaint of hearing voices others cannot hear. He is unable to differentiate between real and imaginary sounds. Which sign from the list below best sums up his condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Perception of sensory stimuli without any external input

options.label: C
options.text: Persistent feelings of sadness and hopelessness

options.label: D
options.text: Inability to concentrate or make decisions

questions.correct_answer: A. Perception of sensory stimuli without any external input

questions.text: A 45-year-old male patient with a history of hypertension and diabetes mellitus presented to the emergency department with complaints of severe chest pain. On examination, the patient was found to be unresponsive with no pulse. Despite attempts at resuscitation, the patient was declared dead. A postmortem examination was conducted to determine the cause of death. What is the most likely finding on postmortem examination in this patient?

A 25-year-old female patient was brought to the emergency department with multiple injuries sustained in a car accident. The examination found that the patient had sustained a head injury, multiple fractures, and internal injuries. The patient was immediately admitted and treated, but unfortunately, she died due to her injuries. As per medico-legal procedures, what is the next step to be taken?

options.label: B
options.text: Inform the police about the incident

options.label: C
options.text: Handover the patient's body to the family members

options.label: D
options.text: Obtain consent from the family members for the autopsy

questions.text: A 27-year-old male presents to the emergency department with a gunshot wound to the left thigh. On examination, there is an entry wound on the anterior aspect of the left thigh, approximately 10 cm above the knee, with no exit wound. The patient is hemodynamically stable, with no signs of active bleeding. X-ray shows a single metallic projectile in the soft tissue of the left thigh. What is the next step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Immediate surgical exploration of the wound

options.label: B
options.text: CT angiography of the lower limb

options.label: D
options.text: Administration of antibiotics and tetanus prophylaxis

questions.text: A 25-year-old male was found hanging from a ceiling fan. The deceased’s family members reported that he had been facing financial issues and was depressed for the past few weeks. On examination, there is blue discolouration of the face and neck, and postmortem lividity is seen in the dependent areas. The hyoid bone is found to be fractured on autopsy. Which of the following is the most likely cause of death in this scenario?

A 40-year-old man complains of difficulty achieving and maintaining an erection during sexual activity. He has a history of diabetes and hypertension and smokes cigarettes regularly. Which of the following is the most likely cause of his impotence/erectile dysfunction(ED)?
A stranger sexually assaulted a 25-year-old woman. The police arrested the perpetrator and charged him with rape. Under what section of the Indian Criminal Code (IPC) is the crime of rape addressed?

A 55-year-old patient with a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is scheduled for abdominal surgery. The anesthesiologist plans to use a Mapleson C circuit for ventilation during the procedure. Which of the following is a disadvantage of using this circuit in this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Increased risk of rebreathing carbon dioxide

questions.correct_answer: C. Increased risk of rebreathing carbon dioxide

questions.text: A 40-year-old male with a body mass index (BMI) of 30 kg/m2 is scheduled for laparoscopic cholecystectomy. The anesthesiologist plans to use sevoflurane as the primary inhalational anaesthetic. Which of the following factors can affect the pharmacokinetics of sevoflurane in this patient?
questions.correct_answer: C. Type of surgery being performed

questions.text: A 35-year-old female patient is undergoing laparoscopic cholecystectomy under general anaesthesia. During the induction of anaesthesia, the anesthesiologist notices that the oxygen cylinder's pressure is lower than expected, and a new cylinder is required. Which of the following is the correct pin index for the oxygen cylinder?

A 45-year-old patient with a history of hypertension and diabetes is scheduled for elective surgery under local anesthesia. During the procedure, the patient suddenly becomes confused and starts having seizures. The patient is quickly intubated, and the surgical team administers appropriate resuscitative measures. What is the most likely cause of the patient's symptoms, and what is the appropriate treatment for this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Hypoglycemia; treated with intravenous dextrose solution

options.label: B
options.text: Local anesthetic toxicity; treated with lipid emulsion therapy

options.label: C
options.text: Anaphylaxis; treated with epinephrine and antihistamines

questions.correct_answer: B. Local anesthetic toxicity; treated with lipid emulsion therapy

questions.text: A 50-year-old male patient presents to the clinic complaining of hearing loss in the right ear and a history of noise exposure in his workplace. The physical examination reveals normal otoscopy findings, a Weber test lateralizing to the left, and a Rinne test showing bone conduction > air on the right side. An MRI scan with contrast is ordered to evaluate the inner ear. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 65-year-old male patient presents to the emergency department with dysphagia and regurgitation of undigested food. A CT scan reveals a Zenker's diverticulum. Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnostic test for confirming the diagnosis of Zenker's diverticulum?

A 50-year-old female patient presents with abdominal pain and is scheduled for a contrast-enhanced abdomen and pelvis CT scan. The patient has a history of allergic reactions to iodinated contrast media. Which of the following is the most appropriate management plan for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Proceed with the CT scan using low-osmolar non-ionic contrast media

options.label: B
options.text: Proceed with the CT scan using high-osmolar ionic contrast media

options.label: C
options.text: Proceed with the CT scan without contrast media

options.label: D
options.text: Refer the patient for an alternative imaging modality

questions.correct_answer: A. Proceed with the CT scan using low-osmolar non-ionic contrast media

questions.text: A patient presents with abdominal pain and is sent for an X-ray examination. The radiologist notes that the X-ray tube output is consistently low despite increasing the milliamperage (mA) and exposure time. Which of the following factors is the most likely cause of this issue?
questions.correct_answer: B. X-ray tube anode target material
questions.explanation:
Structure  Material 
  • X Ray 
  • Cathode 
  • Focussing Cup 
  • Anode = Target (Positively Charged)
  • Window 
  • Filter 
  • Protective housing 
  • Pyrex glass
  • Tungsten + Thorium 
  • Nickel 
  • Tungsten + Rhenium 
  • Glass
  • Al + Cu (~2.5 mm)
  • Pb

questions.text: A 26-year-old male presents with an erythematous rash with a central clearing and a scaly border on his trunk and upper extremities. The patient reports that he had a similar rash on his foot, which has resolved. What is the most likely diagnosis of this superficial skin infection?

A 26-year-old female presents to the clinic with a painful rash on her right buttock and thigh. She reports that the rash appeared a few days ago and has become progressively more painful. Upon examination, the rash is localized to the S1 dermatome and consists of grouped vesicles on an erythematous base. A Tzanck smear is positive for multinucleated giant cells. and PCR testing confirms the presence of herpes simplex virus DNA. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment for this patient ?

A 30-year-old man was admitted to a hospital with complaints of an intensely pruritic papulovesicular eruption on the extensor surfaces, buttocks, scalp, and back. A diagnosis was made that indicated that he was suffering from dermatitis herpetiformis (DH), a chronic, autoimmune skin disorder. Which of the following statements regarding DH is false?

options.label: A
options.text: DH is associated with gluten-sensitive enteropathy.

options.label: B
options.text: DH is characterized by the presence of granular IgA deposits in the papillary dermis.

options.label: C
options.text: DH is primarily treated with systemic corticosteroids.

options.label: D
options.text: DH is associated with HLA-DQ2 and HLA-DQ8 alleles.

questions.correct_answer: C. DH is primarily treated with systemic corticosteroids.

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman presented with a sudden onset of tense bullae on her lower legs and trunk. She also reported oral ulcers and mild itching. A skin biopsy showed a subepidermal blister with a neutrophilic infiltrate. Direct immunofluorescence (DIF) study revealed linear deposition of IgA antibodies along the basement membrane zone (BMZ). Laboratory investigations showed normal serum levels of IgA, IgG, and IgM and a negative antinuclear antibody test. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Observe and reassess in one week

questions.text: A 26-year-old male presents with hoarseness of voice for the past 6 months. He reports no history of cough or throat pain. Laryngoscopic examination reveals a nodular lesion on the vocal cord. The most common site for the development of vocal cord nodules is:

A 58-year-old patient presents with a 1-year history of progressive hearing loss in the left ear. Otoscopy reveals a pale and atrophic tympanic membrane, and audiometry confirms a moderate sensorineural hearing loss in the left ear. Imaging studies demonstrate a soft-tissue mass filling the left middle ear cavity and extending into the mastoid air cells. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 62-year-old patient presents with a 3-month history of progressive dysphonia and occasional dysphagia. Laryngoscopy reveals a smooth, nodular lesion on the right vocal cord, and the biopsy confirms a well-differentiated squamous cell carcinoma. The patient is staged as T1N0M0. What is the most appropriate treatment for this patient?

A 36-year-old patient complains of persistent headache, nasal obstruction, and ear fullness. On examination, there is tenderness over the nasopharyngeal area, and endoscopy reveals a bulging mass in the roof of the nasopharynx. CT scan shows a fluid-filled sac in the region. What is the most likely diagnosis, and what is the appropriate treatment?

options.label: B
options.text: Nasopharyngeal bursitis, antibiotics and nasal decongestants

questions.correct_answer: B. Nasopharyngeal bursitis, antibiotics and nasal decongestants

questions.text: A 45-year-old patient presents with a history of recurrent throat pain, dysphagia, and otalgia. CT imaging reveals elongation and calcification of the styloid process bilaterally. Which of the following is the most appropriate management for this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Surgical resection of the styloid process

questions.correct_answer: B. Surgical resection of the styloid process

questions.text: A 35-year-old male presents with a severe sore throat, fever, and malaise. Examination reveals ulcers with a greyish-white pseudomembrane on the tonsils and posterior pharynx. The patient is diagnosed with Vincent's angina. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment for this patient?

A 65-year-old Peter presented with complaints of progressive dysphagia, odynophagia, ear pain, and weight loss. A laryngoscopy showed a suspicious growth in the pyriform fossa- suggestive of carcinoma. The likely condition was explained. Peter, however, wants to know why a growth in his throat would cause him pain in the ear. What nerve may be anatomically responsible for this pain?

A 10-year-old boy presented with a history of complaints of fishbone stuck in his throat. He, however, did not seek medical help then. He now presented with dysphagia, pain, fever, and difficulty moving his neck. On examination, the patient looks ill, and stridor is present. What is the possible diagnosis?

A 42-year-old patient with a history of diabetes and hypertension presents to the ophthalmology clinic complaining of severe headache and blurred vision. The patient's best-corrected visual acuity is 20/20 in both eyes. On further examination, the ophthalmologist notices a dilated and tortuous vein running over the optic disc in the patient's left eye. A fluorescein angiogram reveals an area of hyper fluorescence around the optic disc. What is the most likely diagnosis, and what other structures in the eye should be examined to confirm the diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Central retinal vein occlusion (CRVO); anterior chamber

options.label: B
options.text: Branch retinal vein occlusion (BRVO); vitreous humour

options.label: C
options.text: Non-arteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy (NAION); macula

questions.correct_answer: C. Non-arteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy (NAION); macula

questions.text: In the 50 years old female, a change in the refractive index of the lens is found while examining. In the physiology of eye refraction, different indices are present in various eye regions. What is the normal average refractive index of the lens?
questions.explanation:
Refractive index of lens 1.39
Refractive index of cornea 1.37
Refractive index of aqueous 1.34

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy came with a progressive diminished distant vision. He has to change the glasses every year. His glasses are becoming thicker every year. There is a recent blurring of vision. Which of the following factors is not correctly related to the condition discussed?
questions.correct_answer: D. Shortening of the axial length

questions.text: A 3 years old male child recently going to school complains of headache & difficulty in seeing the writing on a blackboard as he sits on the last bench. He is advised to do a retinoscopy. What is retinoscopy?

options.label: A
options.text: Subjective method of finding the refractive error

options.label: B
options.text: An objective method of finding refractive error

options.label: C
options.text: Subjective method of correcting refractive error

options.label: D
options.text: An objective method of correcting refractive error

questions.correct_answer: B. An objective method of finding refractive error
